content.description:
A fun 2 pitch face climb with a short approach. Crux moves are well protected.

Approach - 3rd, 60ft

P1 - climb face to headwall, then traverse 5.7, 160 ft

P2 - face to bulge, to sea of knobs 5.9, 80 ft
content.protection: Pro to 2" Two 60's to rappel route
content.location: 200 ft right of the prominent North Book Right. Park at sandy pull out west of DAFF. 15 min approach.

content.description:
Deep chimney/offwidth crack on the North Face of the Lamb Dome.

P1 - 4th class with a few chockstone moves 5.6

P2 - Chimney and chockstones 5.7

P3 - Chimney 5.7 - possible escape left to Green Goblin 5.9

P4 - Squeeze 5.7
content.location: Prominent crack on the North Face of Lamb. Park on 2nd sandy pull out West of DAFF. Hike uphill for 15-20 min.

content.description:
The left of 2 prominent books on the North Face of Lamb Dome. Reid book gives the route 5.7 PG/R, but we felt the pro was good for each pitch.

P1 - 4th class to a 5.7 head wall - watch for loose/cracked chockstone

P2 - Easy climbing up to 5.7+ headwall - we went around this to the right - pro at feet - exposed undercling/side pull - wild!

P3 - Two 5.7 head walls with good pro

Descend north east (climbers left), then down drainage/3rd class slabs or the whole way around the dome
content.location: North Face of Lamb dome - about 15 min approach. Park on sandy pull out west of DAFF

climbs.name: Lambda, Lambda, Lambda
climbs.fa: Tony Lewis, Norm Boles, Brian Bennett

content.description:
A moderate, 2 pitch, mixed route with short approach, great views, and just enough run out to get your attention.

P1 - Wide crack, and face 5.6, 180 ft

P2 - Face 5.7, 150 ft
content.location: Starts just right of the prominent Right North Book. Park at sandy pull out west of DAFF, hike uphill 15 min

content.description:
A Tuolumne moderate multi-pitch with a short approach, and great top out. The climb follows a very large left facing corner to a headwall. There are 2 possible escapes - the first is 5.7, the other 5.5.

P1 - Mostly 4th class 200ft

P2 - Follow head wall left 5.5, 200 ft

P3 - Continue left to 5.7 escape, ~80 ft, or continue to end of headwall, 5.5, 170 ft

P4 - Follow to top 5.5, 120 ft

Descend the gully climbers left of North Books or go around east end of dome
content.location: About 400 ft right of Left Crack 5.8 PG/R (a crack that runs the entire North Face of Lamb)
